content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────
### Stone Furnace for Iron Smelting with Automated Transfer at position(0.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position 0.0, 0.0) that processes iron ore and coal to produce iron plates.
- Output Transfer Setup:
  • Burner Inserter (position 1.5, 0.5) that transfers smelted iron plates.
  • Wooden Chest (position 2.5, 0.5) that stores the iron plates.
- Input Supply Setup (Reconfigured):
  • New Input Chest (position -4.5, 0.5) holding {'iron-ore': 10}.
  • New Input Burner Inserter (position -3.5, 0.5) with warnings ['out of fuel'] designed to feed iron ore from the chest into the furnace.

### Stone Furnace for Copper Smelting at position(5.0, 0.0)
Consists of:
- Stone Furnace (position 5.0, 0.0) that processes copper ore and coal to produce copper plates.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• Burner Inserter Placement Conflicts – Repeated failures occurred when placing the input burner inserter due to collisions with existing entities (e.g. the furnace at (0.0, 0.0) or a wooden chest at (2.5, 0.5)). Mitigate by verifying that the intended placement tile is unoccupied and by adjusting spacing, direction, or reference position as needed.
• Reconfiguration Overlaps – Attempts to reposition the input chest and place a new burner inserter were hindered by residual entities from previous setups. Always remove conflicting entities completely before reattempting automated transfer configuration.
• Inventory Insertion Error – Manual insertion of iron ore failed when the inventory lacked the required resource. Confirm resource availability prior to insertion operations.
• General Placement Considerations – In addition to the above, ensure entity data is refreshed and current (avoiding stale entity data) and check that all target positions are valid (i.e. not on water or occupied) before placement.
